title.rendered: Find Rooms For Rent In Tallahassee, FL

content.rendered:
If you’re planning to move to Tallahassee, you’ll be happy to know that it was awarded the ‘All American City Award’ by the National Civic League, which means the communities here leverage civic engagement, collaboration, and innovation to address local issues.

And if you like the beach, the hills, lakes, forests, and lots more nature, this is the perfect landscape to find rooms for rent in Tallahassee. Here’s everything else you should know.

Getting to know Tallahassee

The capital city of Florida state, Tallahassee is home to the Supreme Court of Florida, the Governer’s mansion and a number of law firms, trade and personal associations including the Florida Chamber of Commerce. It’s also a recognized regional center for scientific research, being home to the National High Magnetic Field Laboratory.

Finding rooms for rent in Tallahassee

Find Rooms For Rent In Tallahasee

When finding rooms for rent in Tallahassee, you should know that it hosts many neighborhoods, as well as gated communities throughout the city.

Top neighborhoods in Tallahassee

Midtown, East Tallahassee

You’ll find historic homes blended with modern styles when finding rooms for rent in East Tallahassee, along with parks, walking trails, boutique shops, cafes, wineries and bakeries within short distances.

Levy park

From students and young professionals, to families and older people, there’s abundant human diversity in Levy Park. You’ll find people from all backgrounds – and wildlife too – when exploring this area to find rooms for rent in Tallahassee.

College town

Although college town was formerly a heavy industrial zone, it has now become a very popular district for students and even young professionals to find rooms for rent in Tallahassee.

Average rent in Tallahassee

University life in Tallahassee

When you find rooms for rent in Tallahassee and finally make the move over here, you’ll be rewarded with a beach not too far away. So when you find your squad in the new city, you can soak in the sun or enjoy a quick swim after hours.

And there’s of course great universities to choose from, especially if you’re studying the sciences, as it is a recognized regional center for the sciences.

Here are the top universities in Tallahassee:

  • Florida A&M University
  • Florida State University
  • Tallahassee Community College
  • Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University
  • Florida Agricultural and Mechanical University

How transit-friendly is Tallahassee?

Walkability & cycling

Like every city, you’ll find some walkable sections, and some not so walker-friendly spots. Some of the walkable areas are Midtown, Downtown and Cascades Park. However, the county and city has been improving walkability with sidewalks, street narrowing and more, to make it safer for pedestrians.

Public transport

The city is served by bus lines like Star Metro, Greyhound & Megabus. While one trip costs about $1 – $1.25 on the bus lines, you can opt for bus passes to cut down on the fare, and avoid paying each time you need to hop on.

Unlimited rides for one day would cost you around $3 and monthly bus passes would cost you anywhere from $20 (students) to $40 dollars with unlimited rides on the bus lines.

Railways

The city’s only railway station, Tallahassee station, also known as the Jacksonville, Pensacola and Mobile Railroad Company Freight Depot, hosted various trains in the past. However, in 2005 when hurricane Katrina hit, Amtrak suspended its services.

Cultural activities in Tallahassee

Southern Shakespeare Company

Love theater, and want to learn more about Shakespeare? Maybe you want to learn to train as an actor? Do it all here at the Southern Shakespeare Company, with their education mission to make Shakespeare more accessible. They have free shows in Cascade Park every spring, too.

Railroad Square Art District

Every Friday of the month, the Railroad Square hosts the ‘First Friday Festival’ that includes open galleries/shops, live music and food. The District is open Thursday through Sunday and has a lot to offer everyday with its unique shops, rock climbing gym, cult cinema, specialty Kayak shop and more!

Lake Ella

You can take a stroll, walk your dog, have some food, or shop from cottage stores around Lake Ella for a quiet day out.

Historical spots in Tallahassee

Old Capitol

Located at the intersection of Apalachee Parkway and South Monroe Street in downtown Tallahassee, Florida, the old Capitol or the Historic Capitol is right behind the new Capitol.

You can take a tour of the restored areas of the old Capitol, which includes the Governor’s Suite, Supreme Court, House of Representatives and Senate chambers. It also has a museum of the state’s political history. You can visit from Monday through Friday, from 8 am – 5 pm, excluding state holidays.

Tallahassee Museum of History & Natural Science

An outdoor museum that’s open every day, with food, museum store, tree to tree adventures, and more! If you’re looking for a great day outside when looking for rooms for rent in Tallahassee, put this one in your itinerary.

Old South at the Mission San Luis

Mission San Luis was home to a community where Apalachee Indians and newcomers from Spain lived together back in the 1700s. Take a trip here to experience the largest historic-period Indian building in the area. You can also explore 300-year-old artefacts excavated onsite, or just enjoy the beautiful outdoors here!

D’you know what else Roomi does outside of helping its readers find coliving advice with their stoner roommate? With our ever-increasing lists of rooms and roommates across the world, we help you find your perfect match!

DOWNLOAD THE APP NOW!
